availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel R. Jones (Bath County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Bath County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary L. Groves Jones in Bath County, Kentucky, in October 1849. Father of Mary Groves. Married to Margaret Comingo Jones in Bath County, Kentucky, on October 6, 1853. Father of James Jones, John C. Jones, Robert C. Jones, and Condit Jones. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 105A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 68.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 16.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Court House Precinct, p. 66B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994028, Bath County Births/Marriages/Deaths.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273005.
"Deaths," Mt. Sterling Advocate (Mt. Sterling, KY), January 17, 1899, p. 7.
